Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and is impressed with two parallel cord-marked lines and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Curator's comments: This differs slightly in arrangement from the usual type. The name of the camel-driver comes immediately after the date, while the place-name is inserted at the end. The different arrangement may be due simply to the difference of clerk.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.175)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36397) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36397)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 254 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
